title: The Silver Palate’s Cornbread Stuffing With Apples, Vegetarian
summary: The Silver Palate’s Cornbread Stuffing With Apples, Vegetarian might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe makes 10 servings with 296 calories, 5g of protein, and 23g of fat each. For $1.28 per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is a rather cheap recipe for fans of Southern food. Thanksgiving will be even more special with this recipe. This recipe is liked by 21 foodies and cooks. It is a good option if you're following a vegetarian diet. If you have eggs, sage, tart apples, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 42%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include The Silver Palate's Corn Bread-Sausage Stuffing With Apples, Silver Palate Banana Bread, and Chicken Marbella - Silver Palate Cookbook.

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel are my top picks for Southern. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. The J.J. Prum Graacher Himmelreich Spatlese Riesling with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 56 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: J.J. Prum Graacher Himmelreich Spatlese Riesling
productMatches.description: "A tad reduced in aroma, this young white has plenty of intensity, offering lime, peach and slate flavors matched to a silky texture. It's awkward today, needing time to integrate. Best from 2008 through 2020. 1,500 cases made." –BS
